thread.title: Showers and clouds today in the Akron area
thread.title_full: Showers and clouds today in the Akron area | cleveland.com

author: Cliff Pinckard, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Showers and clouds today in the Akron area
text:
AKRON, Ohio — Morning showers are likely today in the Akron area and temperatures have dropped.
It reached 76 degrees Thursday but forecasters are calling for a high of only 66 today. Overnight lows will drop into the 40s and there's a chance of more showers overnight.
Skies will clear for Saturday but it will remain cool with a high of 64. Sunday will again be sunny and it will warm back into the 70s.
Here's the seven-day forecast from the National Weather Service:
Friday : Showers likely, mainly before 10 a.m. Cloudy with a high near 66. Southwest wind 8 to 13 mph becoming northwest in the afternoon. Chance of precipitation is 60 percent. New precipitation amounts between a 10th and quarter of an inch possible. A slight chance of showers Friday night before 10 p.m. Cloudy, then gradually becoming partly cloudy with a low around 47. North wind 6 to 11 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20 percent.
Saturday : Mostly sunny with a high near 64. Light northeast wind. Mostly clear Saturday night with a low around 45. Light southwest wind.
Sunday : Sunny with a high near 71. Mostly clear Sunday night with a low around 51.
Monday (Columbus Day) : Mostly sunny with a high near 73. A chance of showers Monday night after 8 p.m. Mostly cloudy with a low around 49. Chance of precipitation is 40 percent.
Tuesday : Partly sunny with a high near 61. Partly cloudy Tuesday night with a low around 43.
Wednesday : Mostly sunny with a high near 64. Partly cloudy Wednesday night with a low around 45.
Thursday : Mostly sunny with a high near 65.
